    "let @xmath1 be a smooth projective @xmath0 surface over a field @xmath4 . for @xmath5 , consider the @xmath3-subalgebra of the chow ring @xmath2 with @xmath3-coefficients generated by ( pull - backs of ) divisor classes on @xmath1 and the diagonal class on @xmath6 .",
    "we denote it by @xmath7 .",
    "regarding its structure , voisin made the following conjecture ( @xcite , conjecture  1.6 ) .      ",
    "_ for @xmath5 , the restriction of the cycle class map @xmath8 to @xmath7 is injective . _",
    "the case @xmath9 is the well - known result of beauville and voisin ( @xcite , theorem  1 ) .",
    "voisin also proved conjecture   for @xmath10 , where @xmath11 is the rank of the transcendental part of @xmath12 ( @xcite , proposition  2.2 ) .",
    "as is remarked in @xcite , section  5.1 , conjecture   turns out to be rather strong .",
    "notably it implies the finite - dimensionality of @xmath1 in the sense of kimura - osullivan ( @xcite ; see also section  [ sec : kimura ] ) , a conjecture that is widely open even for @xmath0 surfaces .",
    "the aim of this short note is to prove the converse : that finite - dimensionality suffices to deduce conjecture  .",
    " _ conjecture   holds for @xmath1 if and only if @xmath1 is finite - dimensional .",
    "_    more precisely , we prove that the relations found in @xcite ( see also section  [ sec : bv ] ) plus the one predicted by the finite - dimensionality of @xmath1 generate all relations in @xmath13 . to achieve this",
    ", we reduce the problem to a manageable algebraic form , whose solution has long been known to algebraists ( hanlon and wales @xcite ) .",
    "further , let @xmath4 be algebraically closed .",
    "as is shown by voisin ( @xcite , proposition  2.5 ) , conjecture   implies the following conjecture for the hilbert schemes @xmath14}$ ] of @xmath1 ( conjecture  1.3 in ; stated for @xmath15 and often referred to as the beauville - voisin conjecture ) .",
    "let @xmath16 be an irreducible holomorphic symplectic variety hyper - khler manifold .",
    "then the restriction of the cycle class map @xmath17 to the @xmath3-subalgebra generated by divisor classes and chern classes of the tangent bundle is injective . _",
    "we thus obtain an immediate consequence .       _ if @xmath1 is finite - dimensional , then conjecture   holds for @xmath14}$ ] and for all @xmath5 .",
    "_    finally , we refer to @xcite in characteristic  @xmath18 and @xcite in positive characteristic for @xmath0 surfaces known to be finite - dimensional . among them",
    "are kummer surfaces , surfaces of picard rank @xmath19 and @xmath20 ( supersingular ) , and some sporadic cases of even picard rank .",
    " throughout , chow groups @xmath21 are with @xmath3-coefficients .",
    "we fix a weil cohomology theory @xmath22 ( singular cohomology when @xmath15 , or @xmath23-adic cohomology in general ) .      ",
    "thanks to mehdi tavakol for explaining the result of hanlon and wales , and to claire voisin and rahul pandharipande for useful discussions .",
    "this work was carried out in the group of pandharipande at eth zrich , supported by grant erc-2012-adg-320368-mcsk .",
    "[ [ section ] ]    let @xmath1 be a smooth projective @xmath0 surface over @xmath4",

    ", we get @xmath46       we refer to @xcite , chapitre  4 for the definition of chow motives over @xmath4 .",
    "a motive @xmath47 is said to be finite - dimensional if @xmath47 can be decomposed into @xmath48 satisfying @xmath49 and @xmath50 for some @xmath51 . here",
    "@xmath52 and @xmath53 are the symmetric and exterior powers respectively .",
    "more precisely , if @xmath47 is finite - dimensional , one can take @xmath54 and @xmath55 .",
    "it is conjectured that all chow motives are finite - dimensional ( @xcite , conjecture  7.1 ) , although this is proven only for the subcategory generated by the motives of curves ( theorem  4.2 in ) .",
    "the motive of a @xmath0 surface is believed to be in this category ( over @xmath56 by applying the kuga - satake construction and the lefschetz standard conjecture in addition ) . however , as we discussed , even its finite - dimensionality remains unknown in general .",
    "[ [ section-1 ] ]    back to the @xmath0 surface @xmath1 .",

    "the only part that remains unclear is the motive @xmath61 , which is define exactly by the projector @xmath62 .",

    "_       first recall the definition of @xmath122 via specht modules ( see @xcite , problem  4.47 ) . define a tabloid @xmath126 to be an equivalence class of young tableaux @xmath127 associated to @xmath123 , two being equivalent if the rows are the same up to order . the group @xmath118 acts by permutations on the set of such tabloids , denoted by @xmath128 . for each tableau @xmath127 , define @xmath129 where @xmath130 is the column stabilizer of @xmath127 .",

    "now we locate @xmath122 inside @xmath119 .",

    "altogether we assign @xmath127 the product @xmath138 it is easy to see that @xmath139 passes to the tabloids and that the resulting map @xmath140 is @xmath118-equivariant . by restriction",
    "we get a morphism of @xmath118-modules @xmath141 , which is injective since it is non - zero and @xmath142 is irreducible .",
    "we may identify @xmath122 with its image .    by proposition  [ prop : hw ] , we know that @xmath122 lies in the kernel of if and only if @xmath123 contains at least @xmath125 parts .",

    "the same holds for the other @xmath148 s again by permutations .",
    "we conclude that the kernel of is entirely generated by the right - hand side of and its permutations . then by the assumption",
    "those classes vanish in @xmath153 .",
    "it follows that the kernel of vanishes in @xmath154 , and that the pairing between @xmath74 and @xmath75 is perfect .      ",
    "( i )  a @xmath155-dimensional analogue of our result concerns a hyperelliptic curve  @xmath156 .",
    "there the ring @xmath157 contains ( pull - backs of ) the canonical class of @xmath156 and the diagonal class on @xmath158 .",
    "it is proven that all relations in @xmath157 are generated by the vanishing of the faber - pandharipande cycle in @xmath159 , the vanishing of the gross - schoen cycle in @xmath160 , and one relation corresponding to the vanishing of the motive @xmath161 ( unconditional ) .",
    "this is the work of tavakol ( @xcite ; see also @xcite ) , which inspired the present note .",
    "it would also be interesting to see if there are higher - dimensional analogues .",
    "\\(ii )  as is remarked in @xcite , section  5.1 , it might be the case that conjecture   for @xmath14}$ ] also implies conjecture  , the two are equivalent .",
    "our result shows that it suffices to deduce the relation from conjecture  . by the work of de cataldo and migliorini on the decomposition of @xmath162})$ ] ( @xcite , theorem  5.4.1 )",
    ", one can express the left - hand side of as a homologically trivial class in @xmath162})$ ] for some very large @xmath163 ( @xmath164 ) .",
    "it remains to see if this class is generated by divisor classes and chern classes of the tangent bundle .",
    "the computation feels like a `` reverse engineering '' of @xcite , proof of proposition  2.6 .",
    "\\(iii )  further , observe that the relations , , and hold in cohomology for any smooth projective surface of albanese dimension  @xmath18 .",
    "the same argument then shows that for such a surface  @xmath1 , all relations in @xmath13 are generated by , , and .",
    "we refer to @xcite and @xcite for recent applications of this result .",
    "kahn , b. , j.  murre , c.  pedrini .",
    "`` on the transcendental part of the motive of a surface . '' _ algebraic cycles and motives_. vol .  2 , 143202 , london mathematical society lecture note series , 344 , cambridge univ .",
    "press , cambridge , 2007 .",
    "moonen , b. `` on the chow motive of an abelian scheme with non - trivial endomorphisms . ''",
    "preprint , 2011 .",
    "http://arxiv.org/abs/1110.4264[`arxiv:1110.4264 ` ] .",
    "to appear in _ journal fr die reine und angewandte mathematik_."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> for a @xmath0 surface @xmath1 , consider the subring of @xmath2 generated by divisor and diagonal classes ( with @xmath3-coefficients ) . </S>",
    "<S> voisin conjectures that the restriction of the cycle class map to this ring is injective . </S>",
    "<S> we prove that voisin s conjecture is equivalent to the finite - dimensionality of @xmath1 in the sense of kimura - osullivan . as a consequence , </S>",
    "<S> we obtain examples of @xmath1 whose hilbert schemes satisfy the beauville - voisin conjecture . </S>"
  ]
}
